reviewText: Fairly good information provided, but in sequences that are not the best.  Background materials are okay, but not as well documented and without any priority given to major events that shaped the rise of Hitler to power, and the weaknesses by the Allies that led to confrontations that resulted in bad diplomacy and compromising nations like Czechoslovakia and Poland.  Also, German strategy to defeat the Allies and Russia not fully explored, such as the overall objectives of the Afrika Corps.

reviewText: I bought this set for the movie other than "Hitlers' Britain", and "How Hitler Lost the War", at walmart for $5, cause I don't believe I had seen the others, though I had bought the two latter separately on two dvds in better resolution, and they were well worth having on individual discs.  This set has alot of overcompression of the videos causing pixelation, but hey, for the price, I paid five bucks, who cares, I could always go for a better copy individually if really appeal to me more, later.Of course, I always find our western education that relates everything to war against Nazi germany in WW2 as a war against Hitler himself, a truly ignorant premise.  Too many documentaries use the same catchy phrase, like "Hitlers flying machines", or "hitlers uboats", or "Hitlers secret weapons", etc, you get the idea, its getting old so fast its too old, its almost like they are afraid of the "nazi" word, like maybe calling it "Nazi Britain", or "How the Nazis lost the war". I mean, hey, one man didn't do all that mayhem, he had help, ya know, from "THE NAZI'S".There is some interesting interviews with Adolph Galland and another german flying ace, both of which served in the post war West German air force in one capacity or another, very good, a must have, you'll want the individual dvds after seeing that.
summary: Great collection at usually a bargain price

reviewText: The evils of the Nazi's and the complacency of the general public during the extermination of the Jewish population during WWII is well documented.  This set of films exposes the blind faith that the German people let themselves be duped into.  Hitler elected the various henchmen that were basically emotionally flawed human beings.  It exposes their attempts to rectify their failures prior to the war by using the Jewish race as their "whipping boys".
summary: Documentary of the Horrors of WWII

reviewText: This is far from being among the better World War II anthologies, but I seem always to find something of interest in whatever I see or read on the subject.  Because most of the world was involved in the War, there are endless perspectives on almost any aspect.  It's foolish, I think, to pay attention only to one view of anything.  This set is such a great bargain at about a dollar a disc, if one has any interest in the War, why not give it a look.

reviewText: Hitler's Britain Was very good except for the fact that Hitler stopped the production of a 4 engine long range bomber in favor of more fighters and twin engine short range bombers. The short range bombers could not reach the more distant British fighter airfields. Had he not stopped the production of the 4 engine " Ural " bomber the battle of Britian could have been won by Germany. It is true that he gave a much needed pause to the R.A.F. that also contributed to his failure.How Hitler Lost The War was much too kind to Hitler especially how he rose to power. The main reason for Hitler's popularity was his attack on the unjust Treaty of Versailles and the world wide depression. Germany was made to pay reparations for the cost of WWI at a time when people were unemployed and Germany money was next to worthless except for building a fire to keep you warm. This is the situation which caused such hatred.Once in power, the remaining of the history presented was accurate. Hitler chased away Jewish Scientists such as Einstein . By the way the Brilliant German scientist Heisenberg deliberatly stalled out the development of the atomic bomb because he did not want to give it to that madman!The Final Solution just tied up more material and soldiers that could have been used on the front and the Holocost was without a doubt disgracefull and was without honor. Many Jewish pilots and soldiers would have fought for Germany. On my recent trip to Germany I was asked by my host if seeing a death camp nearby would interest me. I replied " No, there is no honor in what was done there.As you can tell I am a German-American. My wife's father left all his family back in Germany after WW1 and became a United States citizen. During WWII he served in the United States Army. This is honor!

I HOPE TO WATCH IT AGAIN; BUT THE NEXT TIME BY EACH CHAPTER SEPARATELY. I ALSO HOPE TO WRITE A BETTER REVIEW ABOUT IT AGAIN. FORGIVE WHAT I'VE WRITTEN SO FAR. reviewText: As a historian I am drawn to the WW2 collections on DVD.  This one appealed to me because it had vids I had not seen before.  Well the classic Desert Victory and the Nazi Strike were classic as always.  The three features Hitler's Britain, How Hitler Lost the War and Here is Germany were awful.  The first side of the dvd was soooooo boring I ejected it after trying to find something redeeeming in the features. Just another note, the feature, the Spreading Holocaust, had little to do with the "holocaust" rather it's a mish mash from Pearl Harbor forward.  Quite frankly this set is a waste of plastic.  I've bought better material for a buck.  So save your allowance and look elsewhere.

reviewText: This DVD comes with only one disc and six full-sized documentaries. If you have to realize that the quality is not guaranteed because the films have suffered over time. Please understand how time has harmed the documentaries but they are restored as much as possible. Anyway with a few scratches and signs of imperfection of the early film documentaries, the six documentaries included Academy Award winner, "Desert Victory," which is really just World War II film footage and a narrator talking about the war in Northern Africa.Everybody knows Frank Capra as the father of "It's A Wonderful Life!," but he was also Colonel Frank Capra for the United States Army. He directed "The Nazis Strike" which features the propaganda messages and Nazi newsreel to brainwash a nation. He also directed "Here is Germany," which shows the country as a hard-working nation of good people. It's another propaganda technique."The Spreading Holocaust" displays the horrors of World War II included the concentration camps which killed millions. As the Allied forces invaded occupied Europe, they would soon learn the Nazis horror and inhumane crimes against humanity."Hitler's Britain" is perhaps the youngest of the documenaties by a British and Canadian networks. It's the unimaginable if Britain was invaded by the Germans. The documentary features experts and witnesses."How Hitler Lost the War" is another analysis of how the Third Reich miscalculated their decisions to invade Poland and the Soviet Union among other fateful decisions. It's an important to realize why they lost and the unimaginable possibility if they had won the war.This one disc captures unforgettable images of leaders, dictators, evil, and horrors of war that should never happen again in our world. Just imagine if the wrong side won the war.
summary: A Great Compilation of World War II Documentaries!

reviewText: This 2009 collection of six World War II documentaries by Echo Bridge House Entertainment, covers various facets of the European war, providing several different views of the conflict.  Most of the productions consist of vintage material, which understandably doesn't look the greatest in places, but the footage is still mostly watchable.  The presentation seems mostly objective and generally educational, although each documentary has a particular point of view.  On Side A of the double sided disc are two more recent productions, "How Hitler Lost The War" and "Hitler's Britain".  On Side B are "Desert Victory", "The Nazis Strike", "Here Is Germany", and "The Spreading Holocaust", four older documentaries.The two newer productions engage in some speculation, and are of particular interest.  These features by themselves, might be reason enough to get this collection.  "How Hitler Lost The War" (1989)(66 min.) follows Hitler's rise to power, and then goes on to recount key opportunities missed by Hitler, such as the failure to destroy the British at Dunkirk.  Also discussed are other "mistakes" which contributed to Germany eventually losing the war.  It is postulated that Germany's development of "secret weapons" might have been an even more significant factor, if not for Hitler's decisions to support weapons programs like the V-2 rocket, instead of the revolutionary and potentially decisive ME-262, the world's first jet fighter.  Covering some of the well-establish key points in WW II, this production rates 3.5 stars."Hitler's Britain" (2002)(94 min.) is an extremely fascinating and speculative look at life in England, proceeding under the assumption that the United Kingdom had lost the Battle of Britain, and that England was invaded and occupied by Germany.  Based on Germany's plans for the occupation of Britain, the fictionalized account features real historical figures and imagines how they may have behaved under the circumstances.  Documentary and historical footage is mixed with interview clips and dramatizations of fictional scenarios.The documentary speculates that SS officer Franz Six would be appointed to oversee the occupation of England, and that under Six, those designated as enemies of the Reich would be arrested and executed.  It is speculated the Duke of Windsor might have been approached, to serve as the figurehead leader of the United Kingdom.After the evacuation at Dunkirk, Winston Churchill instituted a program that trained some British citizens in the art of resistance in the event that Britain was ever occupied by Germany.  Part 2 of the feature explores how a group of this organized resistance known as "the Auxiliary", might have functioned in a typical British village.  This makes for some very interesting speculation concerning a rather grim scenario.  Well thought out, based on historical precedence, and with some nice dramatic bits, Hitler's Britain rates 4.5 stars."Desert Victory" (70 min.) is a British production that follows the British Army's evolving and eventually victorious campaign over Field Marshall Rommel in North Africa, capped with a short featurette on the war in the Aleutian Islands.Produced by the War Department, "The Nazis Strike" (42 min.) follows the rise of Hitler, Germany's rearmament and aggression, followed by the invasion of Poland and start of WW II."Here Is Germany" (49 Min.), takes a historical look at the country, and the genesis of WW II.  It makes some valid points, while being a rather scathing indictment of the German people, military, and government, for being the aggressor in two world wars, with Hitler and the Nazis receiving the most venom."The Spreading Holocaust" (52 min.) provides an overview of the war from an American perspective, starting with the country's entry into to the war in 1941, and then following activities in both the Pacific and European theaters, as the USA gears up and fights wars on two fronts.Concentrating mostly on the war in Europe, and with two newer documentaries that feature detailed information and some quite thoughtful speculation, this collection is a very good value buy at four dollars.  As much of this is archival material, you should have reasonable expectations regarding image and sound quality.
summary: a good value, which includes some fascinating historical speculation regarding WW II...
